thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Friday

title: Stocks to watch on Friday
text:
Fri, Aug 7, 2015, 7:31 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 2 hrs 29 mins Stocks to watch on Friday AAP â€“ 7 minutes ago 
Stocks to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Friday, Aug 7: 
ANZ - ANZ BANKING GROUP - in a trading halt at $32.58 
CBA - COMMONWEALTH BANK - down $2.82, or 3.2 per cent, at $84.55 
NAB - NATIONAL AUSTRALIA BANK - down 75 cents, or 2.2 per cent, at $33.59 
WBC - WESTPAC - down $1.05, or three per cent, at $33.44 
A weaker-than-expected profit from ANZ and its $3 billion capital raising have sparked a massive selloff of shares in the big four banks. 
DOW - DOWNER EDI - down 52 cents, or 11.35 per cent, at $4.06 
Engineering group Downer EDI is warning of further hits to come as belt tightening in the mining sector contributed to a three per cent fall in annual profit. 
KMD - KATHMANDU - up 13.5 cents, or 8.9 per cent, at $1.645 
Kathmandu has left the door open for a higher takeover offer after rejecting Kiwi retailer Briscoe's bid of at least $AUD318 million. 
SGH - SLATER AND GORDON - down 10 cents, or 3.1 per cent, at $3.17 
Shares in Slater and Gordon have retraced much of their lost ground after they plunged amid mounting concerns over the law firm's UK business. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
